docs.text: nosferatu the vampyre ( germany 1979 )
docs.label: positive

docs.text: a film review by mike watson copyright 1999 mike watson
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this extraordinary re-telling of bram stoker's " dracula " by german filmmaker werner herzog deserves the most prominent of places in cinematic vampire lore .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: inspired by f . w . murnau's 1922 silent film of the same name , herzog's film is a work of exquisite bleakness , an oddly touching tragedy with a beautiful and uniquely haunting quality that lingers long afterwards .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the original full-length english and german language versions of nosferatu have at last received a video release by u . s . distributor anchor bay entertainment , and in gorgeous widescreen prints .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: until now only a shortened english language version of the film was available on video , and only in europe .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both of these re-releases restore the film to its full length , but viewers should still be wary of the english version due to its often stilted dialogue .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: apparently the english dialogue coach herzog had on the set during filming was incompetent , and some of the voices also seem to be dubbed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the german version with english subtitles remains the definitive one .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: everyone knows the story of dracula .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: or do they ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: his story has been so bastardised on film over the years that a brief reminder of the basic plot certainly won't hurt .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: jonathan harker is a young lawyer sent to the gloomy castle dracula in transylvania to do business with a creepy count ( played by klaus kinski ) who wants to buy a house in harker's hometown .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: upon seeing a photo of harker's wife ( the radiant isabelle adjani ) he instantly falls in love with her .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: locking harker up in his castle , he sets off on a long journey to meet this woman whose beauty so bewitches him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: upon divining his identity as a vampire , adjani seduces the count and lures him to his death one morning as the sun rises .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: that is a story familiar to millions , but herzog has elevated stoker's tale into the realm of - and i use this term a tad reluctantly - cinematic art .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: nosferatu is as much a meditation as it is a film , shot through blue-ish and white filters and peopled with characters who perform as if they were half hypnotised .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film's surreal , dream-like quality is utterly mesmerising .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is much to enjoy , but i'll limit my praise to a few key points .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: holding the film together is kinski's remarkable performance as count dracula .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: past screen portrayals , including bela lugosi's famous turn , have largely been one dimensional and tended towards camp .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but kinski . . . oh boy , this is something far more compelling .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: aided by a startling make-up job , he portrays dracula's vampirism not simply as pure evil but as some sort of loathsome disease .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this man is dreadfully lonely .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he lives in utter solitude , shunned by the locals for his hideous appearance and reputation for bloodlust .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: kinski's portrayal of the count is both creepy and deeply affecting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when he dies , you almost feel as if this man's tortured soul has been freed at last .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: then there's the unforgettable soundtrack , largely composed by german group popul vuh .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is so eerily beautiful and evocative that it's quite impossible to imagine the film without it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: popul vuh are longtime herzog collaborators and play an ancient-sounding kind of spacemusic using piano , chants , and exotic instruments .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when i first saw this film some years ago i was so impressed i tracked down and bought a number of their albums .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the one i still listen to the most is " tantric songs " , from which most of the music in nosferatu is taken .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's a testament to the music's depth that it is as powerful without the pictures as it is with them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the album is still available on the highly respected ambient and world music label celestial harmonies .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is a timely re-release by anchor bay .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after francis ford coppola's unscary and woefully overblown version of bram stoker's tale in 1992 , it is a joy to go back to herzog's film and see the amazing things he has done with what is now a century-old story .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: to some aficionados , nosferatu is quite simply the greatest vampire film ever made .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: without a doubt , it is an unmistakable classic of the genre .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: don't miss it .
docs.label: positive
